I would recommend checking out "The Intouchables" (2011). This French film is based on the true story of Jean-Michel Basquiat and Philippe de Broca, two French painters who became friends with Basquiat after discovering his talent for painting.
In this film, we see how Basquiat's unique artistic vision rubbed against that of his friend De Broca, ultimately leading to the tragic demise of Basquiat on January 24, 1980 at age 25 in New York City.
"The Intouchables" is a French drama film directed by Olivier Darden. It stars François Clément and Jean-Paul Belmondo as two former convicts who find employment in a retirement home in France.
In this film, we see how the friendship between these two former convicts rubs against that of their boss, who has become disillusioned with his job and is seeking to escape from it.

1. Title: American Beauty (1999) | Plot: Part of the March of Time series, this episode focuses entirely on the beauty industry in the USA. With spending of over $1 billion (in 1945)) on cosmetic products, it has evolved into a major commercial enterprise. Packaging has proved to be a very important factor in sales and some $50 million per year is spent on advertising. The FDA look out for harmful products and Federal Trade Commission keeps an eye out for misleading claims. Spas and country resorts, where you can rest and relax, are gaining popularity for those who can afford it as are slenderizing salons and gymnasiums. Hairstyling has become an even bigger business. It's not only women who spend money on beauty products as some $300 million per year is spent by men.
